dcterms:title: Localization of senescent cells under cavity preparations in rats and restoration of reparative dentin formation by senolytics
dcterms:abstract: This study investigated the impact of dental cavity preparation (DCP) on senescent cell formation in rat dental pulp and the potential restorative effects of senolytics (dasatinib and quercetin) on reparative dentin formation. The findings suggest that DCP increases the presence of senescent cells, while DQ administration effectively reduces these cells and enhances dentin formation.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Introduction
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Dentin is a hard tissue behind the enamel that protects against external stimuli that threaten the inner pulp tissue. Reparative dentin, the third dentin, is formed after the completion of the permanent tooth...

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Materials and Methods
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Animal experiments were conducted on 8-week-old male Wistar rats. Cavity preparation and group division were performed under anesthesia...

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Results
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: The establishment of a non-pulp-exposed DCP model was confirmed... Senolytics administration notably restored reparative dentin formation...

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Discussion
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: In this study, we observed an increase in senescent cells... The effects of senolytics on dentin formation suggest new therapeutic strategies...

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Conclusion
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Oral administration of dasatinib and quercetin effectively augmented reparative dentin formation under DCP...
